gov.nasa.worldwind.ogc.ows
Class OWSExceptionReport

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.util.xml.AbstractXMLEventParser
      gov.nasa.worldwind.ogc.ows.OWSExceptionReport
All Implemented Interfaces:
XMLEventParser
public class OWSExceptionReport
extends AbstractXMLEventParser

Parses an OGC Web Service Common (OWS) ExceptionReport element and provides access to its contents. See http://schemas.opengis.net/ows/2.0/owsExceptionReport.xsd.

Service exception reports are generated by an OGC Web Service (OWS) upon receiving an invalid client request and upon detecting an exceptional condition. In either case, the web service responds to the client request with an exception report XML document. Exception reports typically contain one or more independent exceptions indicating an independent error.

OWSExceptionReport can parse an OGC exception report XML document and hold the parsed information, or export an OGC exception report XML document from its current state. To parse an exception report XML document, create a new OWSExceptionReport from a document source and parse its contents by calling OWSExceptionReport(Object) then parse(Object...) on the new OWSExceptionReport. To export an exception report's current state to an XML document, call export(Object).

Field Detail

eventReader

protected javax.xml.stream.XMLEventReader eventReader
The event reader used to parse the document's XML. This is null if the exception report is not created from an XML document source.

exceptions

protected List<OWSException> exceptions
Indicates the exception report's list of web service exceptions. Each exception indicates an independent error. Initially assigned to a new ArrayList.

parserContext

protected XMLEventParserContext parserContext
The parser context for the document. This is null if the exception report is not created from an XML document source.

Constructor Detail

OWSExceptionReport

public OWSExceptionReport()
Creates a new OWSExceptionReport with an empty list of exceptions and no version.

OWSExceptionReport

public OWSExceptionReport(Object docSource)
Creates a new OWSExceptionReport from the specified XML document source. The new OWSExceptionReport is ready to parse the specified document source. The caller must initiate parsing by calling parse(Object...).

Parameters:
docSource - the XML source. May be a filename, file, stream or other type allowed by WWXML.openEventReader(Object).
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if docSource is null.
WWRuntimeException - if the XML source cannot be opened.
See Also:
parse(Object...)
Method Detail

addException

public void addException(OWSException exception)
Adds the specified exception to this exception report's internal exception list. This does nothing if the exception is null or if the internal exception list has been set to null.

Parameters:
exception - the OGC exception to add, may be null.

createParserContext

protected XMLEventParserContext createParserContext(javax.xml.stream.XMLEventReader reader)
Called during initializeParser() to create the parser context.

Parameters:
reader - the reader to associate with the parser context.
Returns:
a new parser context.

createReader

protected javax.xml.stream.XMLEventReader createReader(Object docSource)
Creates the exception report's XML event reader. Called from the constructor that takes an XML document source.

Parameters:
docSource - the document source to create a reader for. The type can be any of those supported by WWXML.openEventReader(Object).
Returns:
a new event reader, or null if the source type cannot be determined.
See Also:
OWSExceptionReport(Object)

doAddEventContent

protected void doAddEventContent(Object o,
                                 XMLEventParserContext ctx,
                                 javax.xml.stream.events.XMLEvent event,
                                 Object... args)
                          throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
Overridden to detect OWSException instances creating during XML document parsing, and add these instances to the exception report's internal exception list.

Overrides:
doAddEventContent in class AbstractXMLEventParser
Parameters:
o - the parsed object to add.
ctx - the XML parser context.
event - the XML document event.
args - optional arguments specified when document parsing started.
Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - if an exception occurs while attempting to read the XML document event stream.

export

public void export(Object output)
            throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
Writes this exception report and its exception list to the specified output as an OGC Web Service Common (OWS) ExceptionReport XML document.

The exported element is formatted according to the OGC Web Service Common (OWS) specification, and is compatible with OWS version 1.0.0, 1.1.0, and 2.0.0.

Parameters:
output - the XML output stream. May be a OutputStream, a Writer, or any type allowed by WWXML.openStreamWriter(Object).
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if output is null, or if output is not one of the recognized types.
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - if an exception occurs while attempting to export the XML event stream.

getExceptions

public List<OWSException> getExceptions()
Indicates this exception report's list of web service exceptions. Each exception indicates an independent error.

Returns:
the report's list of web service exceptions, or null if the report has no exceptions.
See Also:
setExceptions(java.util.List)

getParserContext

protected XMLEventParserContext getParserContext()
Indicates the XML parser context created during initializeParser(). Returns null if the exception report was not created form an XML document source.

Returns:
the XML parser context, or null the exception report does not have a parser context.

getVersion

public String getVersion()
Indicates the version string of the OGC web service that generated this exception report. The version it typically formatted as x.y.z, where x, y and z are integers in the range 0-99.

Returns:
the version of the OGC web service that generated the report, or null if no version is available.
See Also:
setVersion(String)

initializeParser

protected void initializeParser()
Called from the constructor that takes an XML document source, just before it returns. If overriding this method be sure to call super.initialize().

See Also:
OWSExceptionReport(Object)

parse

public OWSExceptionReport parse(Object... args)
                         throws javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException
Starts document parsing. This method initiates parsing of the OGC exception report XML document and returns when the full exception report document has been parsed. If this exception report was not created from an XML document source, this does nothing and returns null.

Parameters:
args - optional arguments to pass to parsers of sub-elements.
Returns:
this if parsing is successful, otherwise null.
Throws:
javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException - if an exception occurs while attempting to read the XML document event stream.
See Also:
OWSExceptionReport(Object)

setExceptions

public void setExceptions(List<OWSException> exceptions)
Specifies this exception report's list of web service exceptions. Each exception indicates an independent error.

Parameters:
exceptions - a list of exceptions, or null to specify that the report has no exceptions.
See Also:
getExceptions()

setVersion

public void setVersion(String version)
Specifies the version string of the OGC web service that generated this exception report. The version should be formatted as x.y.z, where x, y and z are integers in the range 0-99.

Parameters:
version - the version of the OGC web service that generated the report, may be null.
See Also:
getVersion()
